summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence between legal teams regarding the case US v. Maxwell (S2 20 Cr 330). The emails discuss drafting a letter to Judge Nathan concerning legal mail and a hard drive delivery issue for Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC Brooklyn, and coordinate a call to finalize the letter before a court deadline.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell

persons.context: The judge presiding over the case US v. Maxwell S2 20 Cr 330 (AJN), to whom a draft letter is being prepared regarding legal mail issues.

events.title: Discussion on Draft Letter to Judge
events.description: Legal teams discuss and incorporate conversation into a draft letter to Judge Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's legal mail at MDC Brooklyn.

events.title: Court Letter Deadline
events.description: Deadline for submitting a letter to the court (Judge Nathan) by 12 PM, concerning legal mail and the status of a hard drive sent to Maxwell.

events.title: ECF Filing and Mail Receipt
events.description: Bobbi C. Sternheim files a letter with the court and notes Maxwell received mail from USPS; a final pretrial conference is scheduled for the following Monday.

locations: New York, NY 10007 (Law Offices of Bobbi C. Sternheim, 225 Broadway, Suite 715)
keyFacts: The correspondence involves urgent preparation of a letter to Judge Nathan regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's legal mail and a hard drive delivery issue at MDC Brooklyn.
A hard drive was sent to Maxwell on a Friday, and its pickup status needed to be updated to the court, indicating concerns about evidence or legal materials.
The final pretrial conference for US v. Maxwell was scheduled for 11 a.m. on Monday, November 1, 2021.
Staff at MDC Brooklyn do not pick up mail from the post office on Saturdays, only Monday through Friday, affecting delivery of legal materials.
Bobbi C. Sternheim is identified as a defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, with a new office address in New York.
